item.title: How We Made Variable Inspections 87 Times Faster for Unreal Engine in Rider
item.description: üöÄ Exciting updates for Unreal Engine users! Rider’s debugger has seen a major upgrade with the expression evaluator being rewritten. Check it out today! #UnrealEngine #Rider #Debugging #GameDevelopment #TechUpdate

item.title: Thread Dumps and Project Loom (Virtual Threads)
item.description: Java’s virtual threads enhance hardware utilization for parallel I/O-bound operations by mapping multiple concurrent I/O tasks to a single OS thread without blocking. This approach requires minimal code changes, offering a lightweight concurrency model compatible with existing APIs. While this feature benefits developers, it presents challenges for Java tooling. Tools that analyze thread dumps may struggle with the increased volume of data, complicating debugging processes. Thread dumps…

item.title: dotInsights | August 2025
item.description: üöÄ Did you know about C# null-coalescing operators? The ?? operator returns the left operand if it’s not null; otherwise, it returns the right operand. item.title: Configuration Drift: The Pitfall of Local Machines
item.description: Configuration drift can disrupt project development when environments deviate from intended setups. This often leads to issues like inconsistent test results, broken CI/CD pipelines, and wasted debugging time. Common causes include differing package versions and unshared configuration changes. While teams try to maintain consistency through version pinning and environment files, lapses can still occur. Addressing configuration drift is essential for smoother collaboration. üîçüíªüîß #DevOps…
